audio_descriptions.notes:
The screen cuts to black and eventually the title Contre temps appears glowing in blue
The glowing text then fades away

The screen cuts to a dark close up of a clock pendulum swinging side to side. It transitions to another clock mechanism where two balls rotate around half clockwise, and back half counterclockwise. Another transition is made to a clock face with a Great Wave painted on it, and a small clock right next to it. Another cut shows multiple clocks, some analog some digital with one of the clocks having an hour glass on top.


It cuts to show a large dark room tinted blue, with a large collection of different clocks organized on the left and right walls, displayed on shelfs, display cases or by themselves. On the ceiling, a large amount clock pendulums are hanging down. At the back of the room, On the top half, A big clock surrounded by smaller clocks are mounted on the wall. On the bottom half there is a large glass window, shining dim blue light into the room, and outside the window the vague shilouttes of buildings can be seen. The screen slowly pans closer to the window.

It cuts to a closeup of the window, with some small clocks displayed on the window sill. A red fish suddenly appears behind the window and swims across the screen


It cuts to a wide view of the window, where a city is shown under water, with some of the buildings covered with coral. Schools of red fish can be seen swimming around

It cuts to show a close up of the wide array of shiny clock pendulums hanging from the ceiling with the schools of red fish reflected off of them. The reflection then shows a massive school of fish frantically swimming downwards.

It cuts back to the wide view of the window showing multiple schools of fish swimming downwards, below the window, until no fish can be seen


It cuts to a part of the room where a big grandfather clock surrounded by smaller clocks is on the right, and 2 cuckoo clocks on the left. A gentleman with a big basket on his back walks past

The man continues walking while putting on his gloves, he stops walking and sees his reflection off the window. He fixes his tie and continues walking off screen

The man exits through a door leading to a square spiral staircase, with one of the walls being a window. As he goes down the stairs, the water submerging the city slowly drains.

It cuts to a scenic shot of the city, where it shows a ravine between pillars of coral, and coral covered buildings, The water drains off them like small waterfalls.

It cuts to another scenic shot under a highway with yellow sea anemone covering the ground like grass, and in the background the once submerged city can be seen

It cuts to another scenic shot, of a city street now covered with sand and water. The building walls and street lamps are covered with red coral. In the distant background, the man can be seen walking across.

The man sees a unique tear-shaped golden clock embedded in blue coral, and goes to pick it up

It cuts to show a pocket watch underwater in a tidepool. The man's hand reaches down and grabs the pocket watch.

The man is shown emerging from a dark hallway. The man stops for a second and looks at the a gold rectangular clock he is holding. He brushes it off with his hands, then puts it into the basket he has on his back.

The camera zooms out, and it shows the man looking at a telephone booth covered with coral and filled with water and small fish. The man then continues walking off screen.

The scene cuts to a fallen clock tower now covered in coral, the man is shown approaching the face of the clock tower.

 The man gets startled, and looks to his right where there is a door, with two giant toy soldiers on either side.

It cuts to show the dark interior view of the building, with toys scattered across the ground. The man is suddenly shown busting through the door. 

It cuts to show a shelf full of plush animals

On the ceiling there are toy wooden planes and birds hanging down The man's shadow is shown walking around

The man stops walking and turns towards the noise He knocks down some stacked boxes, and reveals a small girl with blue eyes and brown hair holding a toy clock
The girl looks scared and takes a step back from the man. The man approaches and tears the toy clock away from her hands. The man inspects the toy clock, looks at the girl, scoffs then tosses the clock back to the girl in disgust. 

The girl catches the clock, and it shows the girl standing alone, as the camera slowly pans away from her.

It cuts to the man back at the fallen clock tower. On the clock face, there are smaller clocks in a circle around the center. The man uses a large black nail to pry the small clock off the large clock face a little bit, then uses both hands to pull it loose.

It cuts to show the waves of the water rising up.

It cuts to a shot of a car covered in coral, with the water level slowly rising. It shows the man wading through the water, until he sees a girl doll, washing up towards his feet. He then takes a look back behind him. 

It cuts back to the toy shop now flooding with water. The girl is sitting on table above the water, surrounded by stuffed animals. She grabs a small toy boat and plays with it on the water. 

The girl suddenly drops the toy boat and grabs her toy clock, as the man runs in and grabs her hand.

 It cuts to them running away from the water, and up the square spiral staircase. With the water rapidly flooding behind them. 

They continue running, until man notices the girl stopped following him, and sees that she is climbing up a coral structure. At the top, she sees a huge window, and outside the window, the water can be seen rapidly filling up. The girl runs towards the large window, and looks in amazement.

The car covered in coral is then seen slowly moving towards the window. 

It cuts to the man climbing up the top of the coral structure, and sees the girl. With the car slowly inching towards the window

The cracks spread out across the entire window with water shown leaking from the cracks

The man is then shown quickly dumping all the clocks in his basket, into the water.

The scene cuts to the man running with the little girl in the basket on his back.

The man makes a quick turn, with the water rapidly rushing in hot on his tail.

The man is then swept up by the water, and tossed around in the current. The basket comes loose off his back, and the girl is swept away along with her toy clock. The girl frantically tries to grab the clock and when she finally grabs it she holds it against her chest as she is swept away and the screen turns to black.


It cuts to a view above the water, showing the open ocean. A hatch below the water suddenly opens, with both the man and the girl popping out. The man lifts the girl up on the roof, and the girl sets her toy clock down. It shows the close up of the girl getting up on her knees from all fours, and looks up at the man now standing up.


The man contorts his face in disgust of being wet, and flicks the seaweed on his shoulder aside. He then looks out at something in the distance.

It cuts to a shot behind the man and the girl, where a beautiful sunset can be seen over the open water. The tops of buildings and skyscrapers can be seen peaking out above the water.

The man swiftly turns to his right and walks away. The girl looks at the sunset for a little bit, then looks to see where the man is going. She goes back to pick up her toy clock. Looks back at the sunset, then runs to catch up with the man off screen.

It cuts back to man's dark room at the windowsill with the small clocks. However, it now has another addition: the girl's toy clock.

The screen cuts to black.
Roll the credits!

result.title: CGI Animated Short Film : "Contre Temps" by the Contre Temps Team | TheCGBros
result.description:
Here is a beautifully animated and rendered CGI short film about a long-submerged city, and a man is obsessed by the passing of time, by the talented team Jérémi Boutelet, Thibaud Clergue, Gaël Megherbi, Tristan Ménard, Camille Perrin and Lucas Veber at Supinfocom Arles!

Music by Nathan Blais & Sylvain Livenais

More infos at contretemps-lefilm.com

Directed by: 
Jérémi Boutelet: http://www.jeremi-boutelet.com
Thibaud Clergue: http://www.thy-works.blogspot.fr
Tristan Ménard: http://www.tristanmenard.com
Camille Perrin: http://www.camilleperrin.fr
Gaël Megherbi: http://www.gael.m.over-blog.com
Lucas Veber: http://www.lucky3d.fr
Music by Nathan Blais & Sylvain Livenais: 
http://www.spectral-approche.com
http://www.nathanblais.com
http://www.sylvainlivenais.com
Made the official selection at the Annecy International Animated Film Festival and at the Siggraph 2013
